summary.long: Matthew is a book of the New Testament.

verses.text: This is a record of the ancestors of Jesus the Messiah, a descendant of David and of Abraham:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Abraham was the father of Isaac.
Isaac was the father of Jacob.
Jacob was the father of Judah and his brothers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Judah was the father of Perez and Zerah (whose mother was Tamar).
Perez was the father of Hezron.
Hezron was the father of Ram.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Ram was the father of Amminadab.
Amminadab was the father of Nahshon.
Nahshon was the father of Salmon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Salmon was the father of Boaz (whose mother was Rahab).
Boaz was the father of Obed (whose mother was Ruth).
Obed was the father of Jesse.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Jesse was the father of King David.
David was the father of Solomon (whose mother was Bathsheba, the widow of Uriah).
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Solomon was the father of Rehoboam.
Rehoboam was the father of Abijah.
Abijah was the father of Asa.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Asa was the father of Jehoshaphat.
Jehoshaphat was the father of Jehoram.
Jehoram was the father of Uzziah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Uzziah was the father of Jotham.
Jotham was the father of Ahaz.
Ahaz was the father of Hezekiah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Hezekiah was the father of Manasseh.
Manasseh was the father of Amon.
Amon was the father of Josiah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Josiah was the father of Jehoiachin and his brothers (born at the time of the exile to Babylon).
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
After the Babylonian exile:
Jehoiachin was the father of Shealtiel.
Shealtiel was the father of Zerubbabel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Zerubbabel was the father of Abiud.
Abiud was the father of Eliakim.
Eliakim was the father of Azor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Azor was the father of Zadok.
Zadok was the father of Akim.
Akim was the father of Eliud.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Eliud was the father of Eleazar.
Eleazar was the father of Matthan.
Matthan was the father of Jacob.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Jacob was the father of Joseph, the husband of Mary.
Mary gave birth to Jesus, who is called the Messiah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All those listed above include fourteen generations from Abraham to David, fourteen from David to the Babylonian exile, and fourteen from the Babylonian exile to the Messiah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is how Jesus the Messiah was born. His mother, Mary, was engaged to be married to Joseph. But before the marriage took place, while she was still a virgin, she became pregnant through the power of the Holy Spirit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joseph, to whom she was engaged, was a righteous man and did not want to disgrace her publicly, so he decided to break the engagement quietly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As he considered this, an angel of the Lord appeared to him in a dream. “Joseph, son of David,” the angel said, “do not be afraid to take Mary as your wife. For the child within her was conceived by the Holy Spirit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And she will have a son, and you are to name him Jesus, for he will save his people from their sins.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All of this occurred to fulfill the Lord’s message through his prophet:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Look! The virgin will conceive a child!
    She will give birth to a son,
and they will call him Immanuel,
    which means ‘God is with us.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Joseph woke up, he did as the angel of the Lord commanded and took Mary as his wife.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he did not have sexual relations with her until her son was born. And Joseph named him Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus was born in Bethlehem in Judea, during the reign of King Herod. About that time some wise men from eastern lands arrived in Jerusalem, asking,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Where is the newborn king of the Jews? We saw his star as it rose, and we have come to worship him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: King Herod was deeply disturbed when he heard this, as was everyone in Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He called a meeting of the leading priests and teachers of religious law and asked, “Where is the Messiah supposed to be born?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “In Bethlehem in Judea,” they said, “for this is what the prophet wrote:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
‘And you, O Bethlehem in the land of Judah,
    are not least among the ruling cities of Judah,
for a ruler will come from you
    who will be the shepherd for my people Israel.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Herod called for a private meeting with the wise men, and he learned from them the time when the star first appeared.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he told them, “Go to Bethlehem and search carefully for the child. And when you find him, come back and tell me so that I can go and worship him, too!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After this interview the wise men went their way. And the star they had seen in the east guided them to Bethlehem. It went ahead of them and stopped over the place where the child was.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they saw the star, they were filled with joy!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They entered the house and saw the child with his mother, Mary, and they bowed down and worshiped him. Then they opened their treasure chests and gave him gifts of gold, frankincense, and myrrh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When it was time to leave, they returned to their own country by another route, for God had warned them in a dream not to return to Herod.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After the wise men were gone, an angel of the Lord appeared to Joseph in a dream. “Get up! Flee to Egypt with the child and his mother,” the angel said. “Stay there until I tell you to return, because Herod is going to search for the child to kill him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: That night Joseph left for Egypt with the child and Mary, his mother,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they stayed there until Herod’s death. This fulfilled what the Lord had spoken through the prophet: “I called my Son out of Egypt.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Herod was furious when he realized that the wise men had outwitted him. He sent soldiers to kill all the boys in and around Bethlehem who were two years old and under, based on the wise men’s report of the star’s first appearance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Herod’s brutal action fulfilled what God had spoken through the prophet Jeremiah:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“A cry was heard in Ramah—
    weeping and great mourning.
Rachel weeps for her children,
    refusing to be comforted,
    for they are dead.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Herod died, an angel of the Lord appeared in a dream to Joseph in Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Get up!” the angel said. “Take the child and his mother back to the land of Israel, because those who were trying to kill the child are dead.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Joseph got up and returned to the land of Israel with Jesus and his mother.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when he learned that the new ruler of Judea was Herod’s son Archelaus, he was afraid to go there. Then, after being warned in a dream, he left for the region of Galilee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the family went and lived in a town called Nazareth. This fulfilled what the prophets had said: “He will be called a Nazarene.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In those days John the Baptist came to the Judean wilderness and began preaching. His message was,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Repent of your sins and turn to God, for the Kingdom of Heaven is near.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The prophet Isaiah was speaking about John when he said,
“He is a voice shouting in the wilderness,
‘Prepare the way for the Lord’s coming!
    Clear the road for him!’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: John’s clothes were woven from coarse camel hair, and he wore a leather belt around his waist. For food he ate locusts and wild honey.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: People from Jerusalem and from all of Judea and all over the Jordan Valley went out to see and hear John.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when they confessed their sins, he baptized them in the Jordan River.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when he saw many Pharisees and Sadducees coming to watch him baptize, he denounced them. “You brood of snakes!” he exclaimed. “Who warned you to flee the coming wrath?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Prove by the way you live that you have repented of your sins and turned to God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Don’t just say to each other, ‘We’re safe, for we are descendants of Abraham.’ That means nothing, for I tell you, God can create children of Abraham from these very stones.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Even now the ax of God’s judgment is poised, ready to sever the roots of the trees. Yes, every tree that does not produce good fruit will be chopped down and thrown into the fire.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I baptize with water those who repent of their sins and turn to God. But someone is coming soon who is greater than I am—so much greater that I’m not worthy even to be his slave and carry his sandals. He will baptize you with the Holy Spirit and with fire.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He is ready to separate the chaff from the wheat with his winnowing fork. Then he will clean up the threshing area, gathering the wheat into his barn but burning the chaff with never-ending fire.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus went from Galilee to the Jordan River to be baptized by John.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But John tried to talk him out of it. “I am the one who needs to be baptized by you,” he said, “so why are you coming to me?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus said, “It should be done, for we must carry out all that God requires.” So John agreed to baptize him.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: After his baptism, as Jesus came up out of the water, the heavens were opened and he saw the Spirit of God descending like a dove and settling on him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And a voice from heaven said, “This is my dearly loved Son, who brings me great joy.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus was led by the Spirit into the wilderness to be tempted there by the devil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For forty days and forty nights he fasted and became very hungry.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: During that time the devil came and said to him, “If you are the Son of God, tell these stones to become loaves of bread.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But Jesus told him, “No! The Scriptures say,
‘People do not live by bread alone,
    but by every word that comes from the mouth of God.’”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Then the devil took him to the holy city, Jerusalem, to the highest point of the Temple,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
and said, “If you are the Son of God, jump off! For the Scriptures say,
‘He will order his angels to protect you.
And they will hold you up with their hands
    so you won’t even hurt your foot on a stone.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus responded, “The Scriptures also say, ‘You must not test the Lord your God.’”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Next the devil took him to the peak of a very high mountain and showed him all the kingdoms of the world and their glory.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I will give it all to you,” he said, “if you will kneel down and worship me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Get out of here, Satan,” Jesus told him. “For the Scriptures say,
‘You must worship the Lord your God
    and serve only him.’”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Then the devil went away, and angels came and took care of Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jesus heard that John had been arrested, he left Judea and returned to Galilee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He went first to Nazareth, then left there and moved to Capernaum, beside the Sea of Galilee, in the region of Zebulun and Naphtali.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This fulfilled what God said through the prophet Isaiah:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“In the land of Zebulun and of Naphtali,
    beside the sea, beyond the Jordan River,
    in Galilee where so many Gentiles live,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
the people who sat in darkness
    have seen a great light.
And for those who lived in the land where death casts its shadow,
    a light has shined.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From then on Jesus began to preach, “Repent of your sins and turn to God, for the Kingdom of Heaven is near.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: One day as Jesus was walking along the shore of the Sea of Galilee, he saw two brothers—Simon, also called Peter, and Andrew—throwing a net into the water, for they fished for a living.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus called out to them, “Come, follow me, and I will show you how to fish for people!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they left their nets at once and followed him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A little farther up the shore he saw two other brothers, James and John, sitting in a boat with their father, Zebedee, repairing their nets. And he called them to come, too.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They immediately followed him, leaving the boat and their father behind.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus traveled throughout the region of Galilee, teaching in the synagogues and announcing the Good News about the Kingdom. And he healed every kind of disease and illness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: News about him spread as far as Syria, and people soon began bringing to him all who were sick. And whatever their sickness or disease, or if they were demon possessed or epileptic or paralyzed—he healed them all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Large crowds followed him wherever he went—people from Galilee, the Ten Towns, Jerusalem, from all over Judea, and from east of the Jordan River.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: One day as he saw the crowds gathering, Jesus went up on the mountainside and sat down. His disciples gathered around him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he began to teach them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“God blesses those who are poor and realize their need for him,
    for the Kingdom of Heaven is theirs.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text:
God blesses those who mourn,
    for they will be comforted.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text:
God blesses those who are humble,
    for they will inherit the whole earth.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text:
God blesses those who hunger and thirst for justice,
    for they will be satisfied.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text:
God blesses those who are merciful,
    for they will be shown mercy.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text:
God blesses those whose hearts are pure,
    for they will see God.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text:
God blesses those who work for peace,
    for they will be called the children of God.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text:
God blesses those who are persecuted for doing right,
    for the Kingdom of Heaven is theirs.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “God blesses you when people mock you and persecute you and lie about you and say all sorts of evil things against you because you are my followers.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Be happy about it! Be very glad! For a great reward awaits you in heaven. And remember, the ancient prophets were persecuted in the same way.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “You are the salt of the earth. But what good is salt if it has lost its flavor? Can you make it salty again? It will be thrown out and trampled underfoot as worthless.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “You are the light of the world—like a city on a hilltop that cannot be hidden.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: No one lights a lamp and then puts it under a basket. Instead, a lamp is placed on a stand, where it gives light to everyone in the house.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: In the same way, let your good deeds shine out for all to see, so that everyone will praise your heavenly Father.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “Don’t misunderstand why I have come. I did not come to abolish the law of Moses or the writings of the prophets. No, I came to accomplish their purpose.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: I tell you the truth, until heaven and earth disappear, not even the smallest detail of God’s law will disappear until its purpose is achieved.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: So if you ignore the least commandment and teach others to do the same, you will be called the least in the Kingdom of Heaven. But anyone who obeys God’s laws and teaches them will be called great in the Kingdom of Heaven.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “But I warn you—unless your righteousness is better than the righteousness of the teachers of religious law and the Pharisees, you will never enter the Kingdom of Heaven!
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “You have heard that our ancestors were told, ‘You must not murder. If you commit murder, you are subject to judgment.’
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: But I say, if you are even angry with someone, you are subject to judgment! If you call someone an idiot, you are in danger of being brought before the court. And if you curse someone, you are in danger of the fires of hell.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “So if you are presenting a sacrifice at the altar in the Temple and you suddenly remember that someone has something against you,
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: leave your sacrifice there at the altar. Go and be reconciled to that person. Then come and offer your sacrifice to God.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “When you are on the way to court with your adversary, settle your differences quickly. Otherwise, your accuser may hand you over to the judge, who will hand you over to an officer, and you will be thrown into prison.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And if that happens, you surely won’t be free again until you have paid the last penny.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “You have heard the commandment that says, ‘You must not commit adultery.’
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: But I say, anyone who even looks at a woman with lust has already committed adultery with her in his heart.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: So if your eye—even your good eye—causes you to lust, gouge it out and throw it away. It is better for you to lose one part of your body than for your whole body to be thrown into hell.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And if your hand—even your stronger hand—causes you to sin, cut it off and throw it away. It is better for you to lose one part of your body than for your whole body to be thrown into hell.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “You have heard the law that says, ‘A man can divorce his wife by merely giving her a written notice of divorce.’
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: But I say that a man who divorces his wife, unless she has been unfaithful, causes her to commit adultery. And anyone who marries a divorced woman also commits adultery.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “You have also heard that our ancestors were told, ‘You must not break your vows; you must carry out the vows you make to the Lord.’
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: But I say, do not make any vows! Do not say, ‘By heaven!’ because heaven is God’s throne.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And do not say, ‘By the earth!’ because the earth is his footstool. And do not say, ‘By Jerusalem!’ for Jerusalem is the city of the great King.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Do not even say, ‘By my head!’ for you can’t turn one hair white or black.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Just say a simple, ‘Yes, I will,’ or ‘No, I won’t.’ Anything beyond this is from the evil one.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “You have heard the law that says the punishment must match the injury: ‘An eye for an eye, and a tooth for a tooth.’
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: But I say, do not resist an evil person! If someone slaps you on the right cheek, offer the other cheek also.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: If you are sued in court and your shirt is taken from you, give your coat, too.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: If a soldier demands that you carry his gear for a mile, carry it two miles.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Give to those who ask, and don’t turn away from those who want to borrow.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “You have heard the law that says, ‘Love your neighbor’ and hate your enemy.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: But I say, love your enemies! Pray for those who persecute you!
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: In that way, you will be acting as true children of your Father in heaven. For he gives his sunlight to both the evil and the good, and he sends rain on the just and the unjust alike.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: If you love only those who love you, what reward is there for that? Even corrupt tax collectors do that much.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: If you are kind only to your friends, how are you different from anyone else? Even pagans do that.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: But you are to be perfect, even as your Father in heaven is perfect.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “Watch out! Don’t do your good deeds publicly, to be admired by others, for you will lose the reward from your Father in heaven.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: When you give to someone in need, don’t do as the hypocrites do—blowing trumpets in the synagogues and streets to call attention to their acts of charity! I tell you the truth, they have received all the reward they will ever get.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: But when you give to someone in need, don’t let your left hand know what your right hand is doing.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Give your gifts in private, and your Father, who sees everything, will reward you.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “When you pray, don’t be like the hypocrites who love to pray publicly on street corners and in the synagogues where everyone can see them. I tell you the truth, that is all the reward they will ever get.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: But when you pray, go away by yourself, shut the door behind you, and pray to your Father in private. Then your Father, who sees everything, will reward you.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “When you pray, don’t babble on and on as the Gentiles do. They think their prayers are answered merely by repeating their words again and again.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Don’t be like them, for your Father knows exactly what you need even before you ask him!
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text:
Pray like this:
Our Father in heaven,
    may your name be kept holy.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text:
May your Kingdom come soon.
May your will be done on earth,
    as it is in heaven.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Give us today the food we need,
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text:
and forgive us our sins,
    as we have forgiven those who sin against us.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text:
And don’t let us yield to temptation,
    but rescue us from the evil one.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “If you forgive those who sin against you, your heavenly Father will forgive you.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: But if you refuse to forgive others, your Father will not forgive your sins.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “And when you fast, don’t make it obvious, as the hypocrites do, for they try to look miserable and disheveled so people will admire them for their fasting. I tell you the truth, that is the only reward they will ever get.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: But when you fast, comb your hair and wash your face.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Then no one will notice that you are fasting, except your Father, who knows what you do in private. And your Father, who sees everything, will reward you.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “Don’t store up treasures here on earth, where moths eat them and rust destroys them, and where thieves break in and steal.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Store your treasures in heaven, where moths and rust cannot destroy, and thieves do not break in and steal.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Wherever your treasure is, there the desires of your heart will also be.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “Your eye is like a lamp that provides light for your body. When your eye is healthy, your whole body is filled with light.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: But when your eye is unhealthy, your whole body is filled with darkness. And if the light you think you have is actually darkness, how deep that darkness is!
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “No one can serve two masters. For you will hate one and love the other; you will be devoted to one and despise the other. You cannot serve God and be enslaved to money.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “That is why I tell you not to worry about everyday life—whether you have enough food and drink, or enough clothes to wear. Isn’t life more than food, and your body more than clothing?
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Look at the birds. They don’t plant or harvest or store food in barns, for your heavenly Father feeds them. And aren’t you far more valuable to him than they are?
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Can all your worries add a single moment to your life?
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “And why worry about your clothing? Look at the lilies of the field and how they grow. They don’t work or make their clothing,
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: yet Solomon in all his glory was not dressed as beautifully as they are.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And if God cares so wonderfully for wildflowers that are here today and thrown into the fire tomorrow, he will certainly care for you. Why do you have so little faith?
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “So don’t worry about these things, saying, ‘What will we eat? What will we drink? What will we wear?’
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: These things dominate the thoughts of unbelievers, but your heavenly Father already knows all your needs.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Seek the Kingdom of God above all else, and live righteously, and he will give you everything you need.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “So don’t worry about tomorrow, for tomorrow will bring its own worries. Today’s trouble is enough for today.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “Do not judge others, and you will not be judged.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: For you will be treated as you treat others. The standard you use in judging is the standard by which you will be judged.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “And why worry about a speck in your friend’s eye when you have a log in your own?
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: How can you think of saying to your friend, ‘Let me help you get rid of that speck in your eye,’ when you can’t see past the log in your own eye?
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Hypocrite! First get rid of the log in your own eye; then you will see well enough to deal with the speck in your friend’s eye.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “Don’t waste what is holy on people who are unholy. Don’t throw your pearls to pigs! They will trample the pearls, then turn and attack you.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “Keep on asking, and you will receive what you ask for. Keep on seeking, and you will find. Keep on knocking, and the door will be opened to you.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: For everyone who asks, receives. Everyone who seeks, finds. And to everyone who knocks, the door will be opened.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “You parents—if your children ask for a loaf of bread, do you give them a stone instead?
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Or if they ask for a fish, do you give them a snake? Of course not!
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: So if you sinful people know how to give good gifts to your children, how much more will your heavenly Father give good gifts to those who ask him.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “Do to others whatever you would like them to do to you. This is the essence of all that is taught in the law and the prophets.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “You can enter God’s Kingdom only through the narrow gate. The highway to hell is broad, and its gate is wide for the many who choose that way.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: But the gateway to life is very narrow and the road is difficult, and only a few ever find it.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “Beware of false prophets who come disguised as harmless sheep but are really vicious wolves.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: You can identify them by their fruit, that is, by the way they act. Can you pick grapes from thornbushes, or figs from thistles?
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: A good tree produces good fruit, and a bad tree produces bad fruit.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: A good tree can’t produce bad fruit, and a bad tree can’t produce good fruit.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: So every tree that does not produce good fruit is chopped down and thrown into the fire.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Yes, just as you can identify a tree by its fruit, so you can identify people by their actions.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “Not everyone who calls out to me, ‘Lord! Lord!’ will enter the Kingdom of Heaven. Only those who actually do the will of my Father in heaven will enter.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: On judgment day many will say to me, ‘Lord! Lord! We prophesied in your name and cast out demons in your name and performed many miracles in your name.’
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: But I will reply, ‘I never knew you. Get away from me, you who break God’s laws.’
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “Anyone who listens to my teaching and follows it is wise, like a person who builds a house on solid rock.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Though the rain comes in torrents and the floodwaters rise and the winds beat against that house, it won’t collapse because it is built on bedrock.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: But anyone who hears my teaching and doesn’t obey it is foolish, like a person who builds a house on sand.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: When the rains and floods come and the winds beat against that house, it will collapse with a mighty crash.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: When Jesus had finished saying these things, the crowds were amazed at his teaching,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for he taught with real authority—quite unlike their teachers of religious law.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Large crowds followed Jesus as he came down the mountainside.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Suddenly, a man with leprosy approached him and knelt before him. “Lord,” the man said, “if you are willing, you can heal me and make me clean.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus reached out and touched him. “I am willing,” he said. “Be healed!” And instantly the leprosy disappeared.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Then Jesus said to him, “Don’t tell anyone about this. Instead, go to the priest and let him examine you. Take along the offering required in the law of Moses for those who have been healed of leprosy. This will be a public testimony that you have been cleansed.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: When Jesus returned to Capernaum, a Roman officer came and pleaded with him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Lord, my young servant lies in bed, paralyzed and in terrible pain.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said, “I will come and heal him.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: But the officer said, “Lord, I am not worthy to have you come into my home. Just say the word from where you are, and my servant will be healed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I know this because I am under the authority of my superior officers, and I have authority over my soldiers. I only need to say, ‘Go,’ and they go, or ‘Come,’ and they come. And if I say to my slaves, ‘Do this,’ they do it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jesus heard this, he was amazed. Turning to those who were following him, he said, “I tell you the truth, I haven’t seen faith like this in all Israel!
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And I tell you this, that many Gentiles will come from all over the world—from east and west—and sit down with Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob at the feast in the Kingdom of Heaven.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: But many Israelites—those for whom the Kingdom was prepared—will be thrown into outer darkness, where there will be weeping and gnashing of teeth.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Then Jesus said to the Roman officer, “Go back home. Because you believed, it has happened.” And the young servant was healed that same hour.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: When Jesus arrived at Peter’s house, Peter’s mother-in-law was sick in bed with a high fever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when Jesus touched her hand, the fever left her. Then she got up and prepared a meal for him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: That evening many demon-possessed people were brought to Jesus. He cast out the evil spirits with a simple command, and he healed all the sick.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
This fulfilled the word of the Lord through the prophet Isaiah, who said,
“He took our sicknesses
    and removed our diseases.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jesus saw the crowd around him, he instructed his disciples to cross to the other side of the lake.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then one of the teachers of religious law said to him, “Teacher, I will follow you wherever you go.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus replied, “Foxes have dens to live in, and birds have nests, but the Son of Man has no place even to lay his head.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Another of his disciples said, “Lord, first let me return home and bury my father.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus told him, “Follow me now. Let the spiritually dead bury their own dead.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Then Jesus got into the boat and started across the lake with his disciples.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Suddenly, a fierce storm struck the lake, with waves breaking into the boat. But Jesus was sleeping.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The disciples went and woke him up, shouting, “Lord, save us! We’re going to drown!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus responded, “Why are you afraid? You have so little faith!” Then he got up and rebuked the wind and waves, and suddenly there was a great calm.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: The disciples were amazed. “Who is this man?” they asked. “Even the winds and waves obey him!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jesus arrived on the other side of the lake, in the region of the Gadarenes, two men who were possessed by demons met him. They came out of the tombs and were so violent that no one could go through that area.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They began screaming at him, “Why are you interfering with us, Son of God? Have you come here to torture us before God’s appointed time?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There happened to be a large herd of pigs feeding in the distance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the demons begged, “If you cast us out, send us into that herd of pigs.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “All right, go!” Jesus commanded them. So the demons came out of the men and entered the pigs, and the whole herd plunged down the steep hillside into the lake and drowned in the water.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The herdsmen fled to the nearby town, telling everyone what happened to the demon-possessed men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the entire town came out to meet Jesus, but they begged him to go away and leave them alone.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus climbed into a boat and went back across the lake to his own town.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Some people brought to him a paralyzed man on a mat. Seeing their faith, Jesus said to the paralyzed man, “Be encouraged, my child! Your sins are forgiven.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: But some of the teachers of religious law said to themselves, “That’s blasphemy! Does he think he’s God?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus knew what they were thinking, so he asked them, “Why do you have such evil thoughts in your hearts?
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Is it easier to say ‘Your sins are forgiven,’ or ‘Stand up and walk’?
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: So I will prove to you that the Son of Man has the authority on earth to forgive sins.” Then Jesus turned to the paralyzed man and said, “Stand up, pick up your mat, and go home!”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And the man jumped up and went home!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Fear swept through the crowd as they saw this happen. And they praised God for giving humans such authority.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As Jesus was walking along, he saw a man named Matthew sitting at his tax collector’s booth. “Follow me and be my disciple,” Jesus said to him. So Matthew got up and followed him.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Later, Matthew invited Jesus and his disciples to his home as dinner guests, along with many tax collectors and other disreputable sinners.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when the Pharisees saw this, they asked his disciples, “Why does your teacher eat with such scum?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jesus heard this, he said, “Healthy people don’t need a doctor—sick people do.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Then he added, “Now go and learn the meaning of this Scripture: ‘I want you to show mercy, not offer sacrifices.’ For I have come to call not those who think they are righteous, but those who know they are sinners.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: One day the disciples of John the Baptist came to Jesus and asked him, “Why don’t your disciples fast like we do and the Pharisees do?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus replied, “Do wedding guests mourn while celebrating with the groom? Of course not. But someday the groom will be taken away from them, and then they will fast.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “Besides, who would patch old clothing with new cloth? For the new patch would shrink and rip away from the old cloth, leaving an even bigger tear than before.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “And no one puts new wine into old wineskins. For the old skins would burst from the pressure, spilling the wine and ruining the skins. New wine is stored in new wineskins so that both are preserved.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: As Jesus was saying this, the leader of a synagogue came and knelt before him. “My daughter has just died,” he said, “but you can bring her back to life again if you just come and lay your hand on her.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Jesus and his disciples got up and went with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Just then a woman who had suffered for twelve years with constant bleeding came up behind him. She touched the fringe of his robe,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for she thought, “If I can just touch his robe, I will be healed.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus turned around, and when he saw her he said, “Daughter, be encouraged! Your faith has made you well.” And the woman was healed at that moment.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: When Jesus arrived at the official’s home, he saw the noisy crowd and heard the funeral music.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Get out!” he told them. “The girl isn’t dead; she’s only asleep.” But the crowd laughed at him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After the crowd was put outside, however, Jesus went in and took the girl by the hand, and she stood up!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The report of this miracle swept through the entire countryside.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After Jesus left the girl’s home, two blind men followed along behind him, shouting, “Son of David, have mercy on us!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They went right into the house where he was staying, and Jesus asked them, “Do you believe I can make you see?”
“Yes, Lord,” they told him, “we do.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Then he touched their eyes and said, “Because of your faith, it will happen.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Then their eyes were opened, and they could see! Jesus sternly warned them, “Don’t tell anyone about this.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: But instead, they went out and spread his fame all over the region.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they left, a demon-possessed man who couldn’t speak was brought to Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Jesus cast out the demon, and then the man began to speak. The crowds were amazed. “Nothing like this has ever happened in Israel!” they exclaimed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the Pharisees said, “He can cast out demons because he is empowered by the prince of demons.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus traveled through all the towns and villages of that area, teaching in the synagogues and announcing the Good News about the Kingdom. And he healed every kind of disease and illness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he saw the crowds, he had compassion on them because they were confused and helpless, like sheep without a shepherd.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to his disciples, “The harvest is great, but the workers are few.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: So pray to the Lord who is in charge of the harvest; ask him to send more workers into his fields.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Jesus called his twelve disciples together and gave them authority to cast out evil spirits and to heal every kind of disease and illness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Here are the names of the twelve apostles:
first, Simon (also called Peter),
then Andrew (Peter’s brother),
James (son of Zebedee),
John (James’s brother),
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Philip,
Bartholomew,
Thomas,
Matthew (the tax collector),
James (son of Alphaeus),
Thaddaeus,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Simon (the zealot),
Judas Iscariot (who later betrayed him).
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus sent out the twelve apostles with these instructions: “Don’t go to the Gentiles or the Samaritans,
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: but only to the people of Israel—God’s lost sheep.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Go and announce to them that the Kingdom of Heaven is near.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Heal the sick, raise the dead, cure those with leprosy, and cast out demons. Give as freely as you have received!
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “Don’t take any money in your money belts—no gold, silver, or even copper coins.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Don’t carry a traveler’s bag with a change of clothes and sandals or even a walking stick. Don’t hesitate to accept hospitality, because those who work deserve to be fed.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “Whenever you enter a city or village, search for a worthy person and stay in his home until you leave town.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: When you enter the home, give it your blessing.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: If it turns out to be a worthy home, let your blessing stand; if it is not, take back the blessing.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: If any household or town refuses to welcome you or listen to your message, shake its dust from your feet as you leave.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: I tell you the truth, the wicked cities of Sodom and Gomorrah will be better off than such a town on the judgment day.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “Look, I am sending you out as sheep among wolves. So be as shrewd as snakes and harmless as doves.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: But beware! For you will be handed over to the courts and will be flogged with whips in the synagogues.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: You will stand trial before governors and kings because you are my followers. But this will be your opportunity to tell the rulers and other unbelievers about me.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: When you are arrested, don’t worry about how to respond or what to say. God will give you the right words at the right time.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: For it is not you who will be speaking—it will be the Spirit of your Father speaking through you.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “A brother will betray his brother to death, a father will betray his own child, and children will rebel against their parents and cause them to be killed.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And all nations will hate you because you are my followers. But everyone who endures to the end will be saved.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: When you are persecuted in one town, flee to the next. I tell you the truth, the Son of Man will return before you have reached all the towns of Israel.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “Students are not greater than their teacher, and slaves are not greater than their master.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Students are to be like their teacher, and slaves are to be like their master. And since I, the master of the household, have been called the prince of demons, the members of my household will be called by even worse names!
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “But don’t be afraid of those who threaten you. For the time is coming when everything that is covered will be revealed, and all that is secret will be made known to all.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: What I tell you now in the darkness, shout abroad when daybreak comes. What I whisper in your ear, shout from the housetops for all to hear!
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “Don’t be afraid of those who want to kill your body; they cannot touch your soul. Fear only God, who can destroy both soul and body in hell.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: What is the price of two sparrows—one copper coin? But not a single sparrow can fall to the ground without your Father knowing it.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And the very hairs on your head are all numbered.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: So don’t be afraid; you are more valuable to God than a whole flock of sparrows.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “Everyone who acknowledges me publicly here on earth, I will also acknowledge before my Father in heaven.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: But everyone who denies me here on earth, I will also deny before my Father in heaven.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “Don’t imagine that I came to bring peace to the earth! I came not to bring peace, but a sword.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text:
‘I have come to set a man against his father,
    a daughter against her mother,
and a daughter-in-law against her mother-in-law.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Your enemies will be right in your own household!’
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “If you love your father or mother more than you love me, you are not worthy of being mine; or if you love your son or daughter more than me, you are not worthy of being mine.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: If you refuse to take up your cross and follow me, you are not worthy of being mine.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: If you cling to your life, you will lose it; but if you give up your life for me, you will find it.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “Anyone who receives you receives me, and anyone who receives me receives the Father who sent me.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: If you receive a prophet as one who speaks for God, you will be given the same reward as a prophet. And if you receive righteous people because of their righteousness, you will be given a reward like theirs.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And if you give even a cup of cold water to one of the least of my followers, you will surely be rewarded.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: When Jesus had finished giving these instructions to his twelve disciples, he went out to teach and preach in towns throughout the region.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: John the Baptist, who was in prison, heard about all the things the Messiah was doing. So he sent his disciples to ask Jesus,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Are you the Messiah we’ve been expecting, or should we keep looking for someone else?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus told them, “Go back to John and tell him what you have heard and seen—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the blind see, the lame walk, those with leprosy are cured, the deaf hear, the dead are raised to life, and the Good News is being preached to the poor.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he added, “God blesses those who do not fall away because of me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As John’s disciples were leaving, Jesus began talking about him to the crowds. “What kind of man did you go into the wilderness to see? Was he a weak reed, swayed by every breath of wind?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Or were you expecting to see a man dressed in expensive clothes? No, people with expensive clothes live in palaces.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Were you looking for a prophet? Yes, and he is more than a prophet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
John is the man to whom the Scriptures refer when they say,
‘Look, I am sending my messenger ahead of you,
    and he will prepare your way before you.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I tell you the truth, of all who have ever lived, none is greater than John the Baptist. Yet even the least person in the Kingdom of Heaven is greater than he is!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And from the time John the Baptist began preaching until now, the Kingdom of Heaven has been forcefully advancing, and violent people are attacking it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For before John came, all the prophets and the law of Moses looked forward to this present time.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if you are willing to accept what I say, he is Elijah, the one the prophets said would come.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Anyone with ears to hear should listen and understand!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “To what can I compare this generation? It is like children playing a game in the public square. They complain to their friends,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
‘We played wedding songs,
    and you didn’t dance,
so we played funeral songs,
    and you didn’t mourn.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For John didn’t spend his time eating and drinking, and you say, ‘He’s possessed by a demon.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Son of Man, on the other hand, feasts and drinks, and you say, ‘He’s a glutton and a drunkard, and a friend of tax collectors and other sinners!’ But wisdom is shown to be right by its results.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus began to denounce the towns where he had done so many of his miracles, because they hadn’t repented of their sins and turned to God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “What sorrow awaits you, Korazin and Bethsaida! For if the miracles I did in you had been done in wicked Tyre and Sidon, their people would have repented of their sins long ago, clothing themselves in burlap and throwing ashes on their heads to show their remorse.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I tell you, Tyre and Sidon will be better off on judgment day than you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “And you people of Capernaum, will you be honored in heaven? No, you will go down to the place of the dead. For if the miracles I did for you had been done in wicked Sodom, it would still be here today.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I tell you, even Sodom will be better off on judgment day than you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At that time Jesus prayed this prayer: “O Father, Lord of heaven and earth, thank you for hiding these things from those who think themselves wise and clever, and for revealing them to the childlike.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yes, Father, it pleased you to do it this way!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “My Father has entrusted everything to me. No one truly knows the Son except the Father, and no one truly knows the Father except the Son and those to whom the Son chooses to reveal him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus said, “Come to me, all of you who are weary and carry heavy burdens, and I will give you rest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Take my yoke upon you. Let me teach you, because I am humble and gentle at heart, and you will find rest for your souls.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For my yoke is easy to bear, and the burden I give you is light.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At about that time Jesus was walking through some grainfields on the Sabbath. His disciples were hungry, so they began breaking off some heads of grain and eating them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But some Pharisees saw them do it and protested, “Look, your disciples are breaking the law by harvesting grain on the Sabbath.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to them, “Haven’t you read in the Scriptures what David did when he and his companions were hungry?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He went into the house of God, and he and his companions broke the law by eating the sacred loaves of bread that only the priests are allowed to eat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And haven’t you read in the law of Moses that the priests on duty in the Temple may work on the Sabbath?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I tell you, there is one here who is even greater than the Temple!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But you would not have condemned my innocent disciples if you knew the meaning of this Scripture: ‘I want you to show mercy, not offer sacrifices.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the Son of Man is Lord, even over the Sabbath!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus went over to their synagogue,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: where he noticed a man with a deformed hand. The Pharisees asked Jesus, “Does the law permit a person to work by healing on the Sabbath?” (They were hoping he would say yes, so they could bring charges against him.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he answered, “If you had a sheep that fell into a well on the Sabbath, wouldn’t you work to pull it out? Of course you would.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And how much more valuable is a person than a sheep! Yes, the law permits a person to do good on the Sabbath.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he said to the man, “Hold out your hand.” So the man held out his hand, and it was restored, just like the other one!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Pharisees called a meeting to plot how to kill Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus knew what they were planning. So he left that area, and many people followed him. He healed all the sick among them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but he warned them not to reveal who he was.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This fulfilled the prophecy of Isaiah concerning him:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Look at my Servant, whom I have chosen.
    He is my Beloved, who pleases me.
I will put my Spirit upon him,
    and he will proclaim justice to the nations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He will not fight or shout
    or raise his voice in public.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He will not crush the weakest reed
    or put out a flickering candle.
    Finally he will cause justice to be victorious.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And his name will be the hope
    of all the world.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then a demon-possessed man, who was blind and couldn’t speak, was brought to Jesus. He healed the man so that he could both speak and see.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The crowd was amazed and asked, “Could it be that Jesus is the Son of David, the Messiah?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when the Pharisees heard about the miracle, they said, “No wonder he can cast out demons. He gets his power from Satan, the prince of demons.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus knew their thoughts and replied, “Any kingdom divided by civil war is doomed. A town or family splintered by feuding will fall apart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if Satan is casting out Satan, he is divided and fighting against himself. His own kingdom will not survive.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if I am empowered by Satan, what about your own exorcists? They cast out demons, too, so they will condemn you for what you have said.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if I am casting out demons by the Spirit of God, then the Kingdom of God has arrived among you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For who is powerful enough to enter the house of a strong man and plunder his goods? Only someone even stronger—someone who could tie him up and then plunder his house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Anyone who isn’t with me opposes me, and anyone who isn’t working with me is actually working against me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “So I tell you, every sin and blasphemy can be forgiven—except blasphemy against the Holy Spirit, which will never be forgiven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Anyone who speaks against the Son of Man can be forgiven, but anyone who speaks against the Holy Spirit will never be forgiven, either in this world or in the world to come.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “A tree is identified by its fruit. If a tree is good, its fruit will be good. If a tree is bad, its fruit will be bad.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You brood of snakes! How could evil men like you speak what is good and right? For whatever is in your heart determines what you say.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A good person produces good things from the treasury of a good heart, and an evil person produces evil things from the treasury of an evil heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I tell you this, you must give an account on judgment day for every idle word you speak.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The words you say will either acquit you or condemn you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: One day some teachers of religious law and Pharisees came to Jesus and said, “Teacher, we want you to show us a miraculous sign to prove your authority.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus replied, “Only an evil, adulterous generation would demand a miraculous sign; but the only sign I will give them is the sign of the prophet Jonah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For as Jonah was in the belly of the great fish for three days and three nights, so will the Son of Man be in the heart of the earth for three days and three nights.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The people of Nineveh will stand up against this generation on judgment day and condemn it, for they repented of their sins at the preaching of Jonah. Now someone greater than Jonah is here—but you refuse to repent.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The queen of Sheba will also stand up against this generation on judgment day and condemn it, for she came from a distant land to hear the wisdom of Solomon. Now someone greater than Solomon is here—but you refuse to listen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “When an evil spirit leaves a person, it goes into the desert, seeking rest but finding none.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then it says, ‘I will return to the person I came from.’ So it returns and finds its former home empty, swept, and in order.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the spirit finds seven other spirits more evil than itself, and they all enter the person and live there. And so that person is worse off than before. That will be the experience of this evil generation.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As Jesus was speaking to the crowd, his mother and brothers stood outside, asking to speak to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Someone told Jesus, “Your mother and your brothers are standing outside, and they want to speak to you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus asked, “Who is my mother? Who are my brothers?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he pointed to his disciples and said, “Look, these are my mother and brothers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Anyone who does the will of my Father in heaven is my brother and sister and mother!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Later that same day Jesus left the house and sat beside the lake.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A large crowd soon gathered around him, so he got into a boat. Then he sat there and taught as the people stood on the shore.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He told many stories in the form of parables, such as this one:
“Listen! A farmer went out to plant some seeds.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As he scattered them across his field, some seeds fell on a footpath, and the birds came and ate them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Other seeds fell on shallow soil with underlying rock. The seeds sprouted quickly because the soil was shallow.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the plants soon wilted under the hot sun, and since they didn’t have deep roots, they died.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Other seeds fell among thorns that grew up and choked out the tender plants.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Still other seeds fell on fertile soil, and they produced a crop that was thirty, sixty, and even a hundred times as much as had been planted!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Anyone with ears to hear should listen and understand.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His disciples came and asked him, “Why do you use parables when you talk to the people?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He replied, “You are permitted to understand the secrets of the Kingdom of Heaven, but others are not.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To those who listen to my teaching, more understanding will be given, and they will have an abundance of knowledge. But for those who are not listening, even what little understanding they have will be taken away from them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
That is why I use these parables,
For they look, but they don’t really see.
    They hear, but they don’t really listen or understand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
This fulfills the prophecy of Isaiah that says,
‘When you hear what I say,
    you will not understand.
When you see what I do,
    you will not comprehend.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For the hearts of these people are hardened,
    and their ears cannot hear,
and they have closed their eyes—
    so their eyes cannot see,
and their ears cannot hear,
    and their hearts cannot understand,
and they cannot turn to me
    and let me heal them.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But blessed are your eyes, because they see; and your ears, because they hear.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I tell you the truth, many prophets and righteous people longed to see what you see, but they didn’t see it. And they longed to hear what you hear, but they didn’t hear it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Now listen to the explanation of the parable about the farmer planting seeds:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The seed that fell on the footpath represents those who hear the message about the Kingdom and don’t understand it. Then the evil one comes and snatches away the seed that was planted in their hearts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The seed on the rocky soil represents those who hear the message and immediately receive it with joy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But since they don’t have deep roots, they don’t last long. They fall away as soon as they have problems or are persecuted for believing God’s word.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The seed that fell among the thorns represents those who hear God’s word, but all too quickly the message is crowded out by the worries of this life and the lure of wealth, so no fruit is produced.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The seed that fell on good soil represents those who truly hear and understand God’s word and produce a harvest of thirty, sixty, or even a hundred times as much as had been planted!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Here is another story Jesus told: “The Kingdom of Heaven is like a farmer who planted good seed in his field.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But that night as the workers slept, his enemy came and planted weeds among the wheat, then slipped away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the crop began to grow and produce grain, the weeds also grew.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The farmer’s workers went to him and said, ‘Sir, the field where you planted that good seed is full of weeds! Where did they come from?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“‘An enemy has done this!’ the farmer exclaimed.
“‘Should we pull out the weeds?’ they asked.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘No,’ he replied, ‘you’ll uproot the wheat if you do.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let both grow together until the harvest. Then I will tell the harvesters to sort out the weeds, tie them into bundles, and burn them, and to put the wheat in the barn.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Here is another illustration Jesus used: “The Kingdom of Heaven is like a mustard seed planted in a field.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It is the smallest of all seeds, but it becomes the largest of garden plants; it grows into a tree, and birds come and make nests in its branches.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus also used this illustration: “The Kingdom of Heaven is like the yeast a woman used in making bread. Even though she put only a little yeast in three measures of flour, it permeated every part of the dough.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus always used stories and illustrations like these when speaking to the crowds. In fact, he never spoke to them without using such parables.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
This fulfilled what God had spoken through the prophet:
“I will speak to you in parables.
    I will explain things hidden since the creation of the world.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then, leaving the crowds outside, Jesus went into the house. His disciples said, “Please explain to us the story of the weeds in the field.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus replied, “The Son of Man is the farmer who plants the good seed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The field is the world, and the good seed represents the people of the Kingdom. The weeds are the people who belong to the evil one.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The enemy who planted the weeds among the wheat is the devil. The harvest is the end of the world, and the harvesters are the angels.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Just as the weeds are sorted out and burned in the fire, so it will be at the end of the world.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Son of Man will send his angels, and they will remove from his Kingdom everything that causes sin and all who do evil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the angels will throw them into the fiery furnace, where there will be weeping and gnashing of teeth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the righteous will shine like the sun in their Father’s Kingdom. Anyone with ears to hear should listen and understand!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The Kingdom of Heaven is like a treasure that a man discovered hidden in a field. In his excitement, he hid it again and sold everything he owned to get enough money to buy the field.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Again, the Kingdom of Heaven is like a merchant on the lookout for choice pearls.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he discovered a pearl of great value, he sold everything he owned and bought it!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Again, the Kingdom of Heaven is like a fishing net that was thrown into the water and caught fish of every kind.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the net was full, they dragged it up onto the shore, sat down, and sorted the good fish into crates, but threw the bad ones away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: That is the way it will be at the end of the world. The angels will come and separate the wicked people from the righteous,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: throwing the wicked into the fiery furnace, where there will be weeping and gnashing of teeth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do you understand all these things?”
“Yes,” they said, “we do.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he added, “Every teacher of religious law who becomes a disciple in the Kingdom of Heaven is like a homeowner who brings from his storeroom new gems of truth as well as old.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jesus had finished telling these stories and illustrations, he left that part of the country.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He returned to Nazareth, his hometown. When he taught there in the synagogue, everyone was amazed and said, “Where does he get this wisdom and the power to do miracles?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they scoffed, “He’s just the carpenter’s son, and we know Mary, his mother, and his brothers—James, Joseph, Simon, and Judas.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All his sisters live right here among us. Where did he learn all these things?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And they were deeply offended and refused to believe in him.
Then Jesus told them, “A prophet is honored everywhere except in his own hometown and among his own family.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And so he did only a few miracles there because of their unbelief.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Herod Antipas, the ruler of Galilee, heard about Jesus,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: he said to his advisers, “This must be John the Baptist raised from the dead! That is why he can do such miracles.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For Herod had arrested and imprisoned John as a favor to his wife Herodias (the former wife of Herod’s brother Philip).
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: John had been telling Herod, “It is against God’s law for you to marry her.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Herod wanted to kill John, but he was afraid of a riot, because all the people believed John was a prophet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But at a birthday party for Herod, Herodias’s daughter performed a dance that greatly pleased him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so he promised with a vow to give her anything she wanted.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At her mother’s urging, the girl said, “I want the head of John the Baptist on a tray!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the king regretted what he had said; but because of the vow he had made in front of his guests, he issued the necessary orders.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So John was beheaded in the prison,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and his head was brought on a tray and given to the girl, who took it to her mother.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Later, John’s disciples came for his body and buried it. Then they went and told Jesus what had happened.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As soon as Jesus heard the news, he left in a boat to a remote area to be alone. But the crowds heard where he was headed and followed on foot from many towns.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus saw the huge crowd as he stepped from the boat, and he had compassion on them and healed their sick.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: That evening the disciples came to him and said, “This is a remote place, and it’s already getting late. Send the crowds away so they can go to the villages and buy food for themselves.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus said, “That isn’t necessary—you feed them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But we have only five loaves of bread and two fish!” they answered.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Bring them here,” he said.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he told the people to sit down on the grass. Jesus took the five loaves and two fish, looked up toward heaven, and blessed them. Then, breaking the loaves into pieces, he gave the bread to the disciples, who distributed it to the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They all ate as much as they wanted, and afterward, the disciples picked up twelve baskets of leftovers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: About 5,000 men were fed that day, in addition to all the women and children!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Immediately after this, Jesus insisted that his disciples get back into the boat and cross to the other side of the lake, while he sent the people home.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After sending them home, he went up into the hills by himself to pray. Night fell while he was there alone.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Meanwhile, the disciples were in trouble far away from land, for a strong wind had risen, and they were fighting heavy waves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: About three o’clock in the morning Jesus came toward them, walking on the water.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the disciples saw him walking on the water, they were terrified. In their fear, they cried out, “It’s a ghost!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus spoke to them at once. “Don’t be afraid,” he said. “Take courage. I am here!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Peter called to him, “Lord, if it’s really you, tell me to come to you, walking on the water.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Yes, come,” Jesus said.
So Peter went over the side of the boat and walked on the water toward Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when he saw the strong wind and the waves, he was terrified and began to sink. “Save me, Lord!” he shouted.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus immediately reached out and grabbed him. “You have so little faith,” Jesus said. “Why did you doubt me?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they climbed back into the boat, the wind stopped.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the disciples worshiped him. “You really are the Son of God!” they exclaimed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After they had crossed the lake, they landed at Gennesaret.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the people recognized Jesus, the news of his arrival spread quickly throughout the whole area, and soon people were bringing all their sick to be healed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They begged him to let the sick touch at least the fringe of his robe, and all who touched him were healed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Some Pharisees and teachers of religious law now arrived from Jerusalem to see Jesus. They asked him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Why do your disciples disobey our age-old tradition? For they ignore our tradition of ceremonial hand washing before they eat.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus replied, “And why do you, by your traditions, violate the direct commandments of God?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For instance, God says, ‘Honor your father and mother,’ and ‘Anyone who speaks disrespectfully of father or mother must be put to death.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But you say it is all right for people to say to their parents, ‘Sorry, I can’t help you. For I have vowed to give to God what I would have given to you.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In this way, you say they don’t need to honor their parents. And so you cancel the word of God for the sake of your own tradition.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You hypocrites! Isaiah was right when he prophesied about you, for he wrote,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
‘These people honor me with their lips,
    but their hearts are far from me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Their worship is a farce,
    for they teach man-made ideas as commands from God.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus called to the crowd to come and hear. “Listen,” he said, “and try to understand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It’s not what goes into your mouth that defiles you; you are defiled by the words that come out of your mouth.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the disciples came to him and asked, “Do you realize you offended the Pharisees by what you just said?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus replied, “Every plant not planted by my heavenly Father will be uprooted,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so ignore them. They are blind guides leading the blind, and if one blind person guides another, they will both fall into a ditch.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Peter said to Jesus, “Explain to us the parable that says people aren’t defiled by what they eat.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Don’t you understand yet?” Jesus asked.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Anything you eat passes through the stomach and then goes into the sewer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the words you speak come from the heart—that’s what defiles you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For from the heart come evil thoughts, murder, adultery, all sexual immorality, theft, lying, and slander.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are what defile you. Eating with unwashed hands will never defile you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus left Galilee and went north to the region of Tyre and Sidon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A Gentile woman who lived there came to him, pleading, “Have mercy on me, O Lord, Son of David! For my daughter is possessed by a demon that torments her severely.”
verses.speaker: Narrator
