verses.text: But Jesus gave her no reply, not even a word. Then his disciples urged him to send her away. “Tell her to go away,” they said. “She is bothering us with all her begging.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus said to the woman, “I was sent only to help God’s lost sheep—the people of Israel.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But she came and worshiped him, pleading again, “Lord, help me!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus responded, “It isn’t right to take food from the children and throw it to the dogs.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She replied, “That’s true, Lord, but even dogs are allowed to eat the scraps that fall beneath their masters’ table.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Dear woman,” Jesus said to her, “your faith is great. Your request is granted.” And her daughter was instantly healed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus returned to the Sea of Galilee and climbed a hill and sat down.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A vast crowd brought to him people who were lame, blind, crippled, those who couldn’t speak, and many others. They laid them before Jesus, and he healed them all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The crowd was amazed! Those who hadn’t been able to speak were talking, the crippled were made well, the lame were walking, and the blind could see again! And they praised the God of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus called his disciples and told them, “I feel sorry for these people. They have been here with me for three days, and they have nothing left to eat. I don’t want to send them away hungry, or they will faint along the way.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The disciples replied, “Where would we get enough food here in the wilderness for such a huge crowd?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Jesus asked, “How much bread do you have?”
They replied, “Seven loaves, and a few small fish.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Jesus told all the people to sit down on the ground.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he took the seven loaves and the fish, thanked God for them, and broke them into pieces. He gave them to the disciples, who distributed the food to the crowd.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They all ate as much as they wanted. Afterward, the disciples picked up seven large baskets of leftover food.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There were 4,000 men who were fed that day, in addition to all the women and children.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus sent the people home, and he got into a boat and crossed over to the region of Magadan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: One day the Pharisees and Sadducees came to test Jesus, demanding that he show them a miraculous sign from heaven to prove his authority.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He replied, “You know the saying, ‘Red sky at night means fair weather tomorrow;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: red sky in the morning means foul weather all day.’ You know how to interpret the weather signs in the sky, but you don’t know how to interpret the signs of the times!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Only an evil, adulterous generation would demand a miraculous sign, but the only sign I will give them is the sign of the prophet Jonah.” Then Jesus left them and went away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Later, after they crossed to the other side of the lake, the disciples discovered they had forgotten to bring any bread.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Watch out!” Jesus warned them. “Beware of the yeast of the Pharisees and Sadducees.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At this they began to argue with each other because they hadn’t brought any bread.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus knew what they were saying, so he said, “You have so little faith! Why are you arguing with each other about having no bread?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Don’t you understand even yet? Don’t you remember the 5,000 I fed with five loaves, and the baskets of leftovers you picked up?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Or the 4,000 I fed with seven loaves, and the large baskets of leftovers you picked up?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Why can’t you understand that I’m not talking about bread? So again I say, ‘Beware of the yeast of the Pharisees and Sadducees.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then at last they understood that he wasn’t speaking about the yeast in bread, but about the deceptive teaching of the Pharisees and Sadducees.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jesus came to the region of Caesarea Philippi, he asked his disciples, “Who do people say that the Son of Man is?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Well,” they replied, “some say John the Baptist, some say Elijah, and others say Jeremiah or one of the other prophets.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he asked them, “But who do you say I am?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Simon Peter answered, “You are the Messiah, the Son of the living God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus replied, “You are blessed, Simon son of John, because my Father in heaven has revealed this to you. You did not learn this from any human being.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now I say to you that you are Peter (which means ‘rock’), and upon this rock I will build my church, and all the powers of hell will not conquer it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I will give you the keys of the Kingdom of Heaven. Whatever you forbid on earth will be forbidden in heaven, and whatever you permit on earth will be permitted in heaven.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he sternly warned the disciples not to tell anyone that he was the Messiah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From then on Jesus began to tell his disciples plainly that it was necessary for him to go to Jerusalem, and that he would suffer many terrible things at the hands of the elders, the leading priests, and the teachers of religious law. He would be killed, but on the third day he would be raised from the dead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Peter took him aside and began to reprimand him for saying such things. “Heaven forbid, Lord,” he said. “This will never happen to you!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus turned to Peter and said, “Get away from me, Satan! You are a dangerous trap to me. You are seeing things merely from a human point of view, not from God’s.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus said to his disciples, “If any of you wants to be my follower, you must give up your own way, take up your cross, and follow me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If you try to hang on to your life, you will lose it. But if you give up your life for my sake, you will save it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And what do you benefit if you gain the whole world but lose your own soul? Is anything worth more than your soul?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the Son of Man will come with his angels in the glory of his Father and will judge all people according to their deeds.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I tell you the truth, some standing here right now will not die before they see the Son of Man coming in his Kingdom.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Six days later Jesus took Peter and the two brothers, James and John, and led them up a high mountain to be alone.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As the men watched, Jesus’ appearance was transformed so that his face shone like the sun, and his clothes became as white as light.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Suddenly, Moses and Elijah appeared and began talking with Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Peter exclaimed, “Lord, it’s wonderful for us to be here! If you want, I’ll make three shelters as memorials—one for you, one for Moses, and one for Elijah.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But even as he spoke, a bright cloud overshadowed them, and a voice from the cloud said, “This is my dearly loved Son, who brings me great joy. Listen to him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The disciples were terrified and fell face down on the ground.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus came over and touched them. “Get up,” he said. “Don’t be afraid.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when they looked up, Moses and Elijah were gone, and they saw only Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As they went back down the mountain, Jesus commanded them, “Don’t tell anyone what you have seen until the Son of Man has been raised from the dead.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then his disciples asked him, “Why do the teachers of religious law insist that Elijah must return before the Messiah comes?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus replied, “Elijah is indeed coming first to get everything ready.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But I tell you, Elijah has already come, but he wasn’t recognized, and they chose to abuse him. And in the same way they will also make the Son of Man suffer.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the disciples realized he was talking about John the Baptist.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At the foot of the mountain, a large crowd was waiting for them. A man came and knelt before Jesus and said,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Lord, have mercy on my son. He has seizures and suffers terribly. He often falls into the fire or into the water.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So I brought him to your disciples, but they couldn’t heal him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said, “You faithless and corrupt people! How long must I be with you? How long must I put up with you? Bring the boy here to me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus rebuked the demon in the boy, and it left him. From that moment the boy was well.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Afterward the disciples asked Jesus privately, “Why couldn’t we cast out that demon?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You don’t have enough faith,” Jesus told them. “I tell you the truth, if you had faith even as small as a mustard seed, you could say to this mountain, ‘Move from here to there,’ and it would move. Nothing would be impossible.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After they gathered again in Galilee, Jesus told them, “The Son of Man is going to be betrayed into the hands of his enemies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He will be killed, but on the third day he will be raised from the dead.” And the disciples were filled with grief.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On their arrival in Capernaum, the collectors of the Temple tax came to Peter and asked him, “Doesn’t your teacher pay the Temple tax?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Yes, he does,” Peter replied. Then he went into the house.
But before he had a chance to speak, Jesus asked him, “What do you think, Peter? Do kings tax their own people or the people they have conquered?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“They tax the people they have conquered,” Peter replied.
“Well, then,” Jesus said, “the citizens are free!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: However, we don’t want to offend them, so go down to the lake and throw in a line. Open the mouth of the first fish you catch, and you will find a large silver coin. Take it and pay the tax for both of us.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: About that time the disciples came to Jesus and asked, “Who is greatest in the Kingdom of Heaven?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus called a little child to him and put the child among them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he said, “I tell you the truth, unless you turn from your sins and become like little children, you will never get into the Kingdom of Heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So anyone who becomes as humble as this little child is the greatest in the Kingdom of Heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “And anyone who welcomes a little child like this on my behalf is welcoming me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if you cause one of these little ones who trusts in me to fall into sin, it would be better for you to have a large millstone tied around your neck and be drowned in the depths of the sea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “What sorrow awaits the world, because it tempts people to sin. Temptations are inevitable, but what sorrow awaits the person who does the tempting.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So if your hand or foot causes you to sin, cut it off and throw it away. It’s better to enter eternal life with only one hand or one foot than to be thrown into eternal fire with both of your hands and feet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if your eye causes you to sin, gouge it out and throw it away. It’s better to enter eternal life with only one eye than to have two eyes and be thrown into the fire of hell.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Beware that you don’t look down on any of these little ones. For I tell you that in heaven their angels are always in the presence of my heavenly Father.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If a man has a hundred sheep and one of them wanders away, what will he do? Won’t he leave the ninety-nine others on the hills and go out to search for the one that is lost?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if he finds it, I tell you the truth, he will rejoice over it more than over the ninety-nine that didn’t wander away!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the same way, it is not my heavenly Father’s will that even one of these little ones should perish.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If another believer sins against you, go privately and point out the offense. If the other person listens and confesses it, you have won that person back.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if you are unsuccessful, take one or two others with you and go back again, so that everything you say may be confirmed by two or three witnesses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If the person still refuses to listen, take your case to the church. Then if he or she won’t accept the church’s decision, treat that person as a pagan or a corrupt tax collector.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I tell you the truth, whatever you forbid on earth will be forbidden in heaven, and whatever you permit on earth will be permitted in heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I also tell you this: If two of you agree here on earth concerning anything you ask, my Father in heaven will do it for you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For where two or three gather together as my followers, I am there among them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Peter came to him and asked, “Lord, how often should I forgive someone who sins against me? Seven times?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “No, not seven times,” Jesus replied, “but seventy times seven!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Therefore, the Kingdom of Heaven can be compared to a king who decided to bring his accounts up to date with servants who had borrowed money from him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the process, one of his debtors was brought in who owed him millions of dollars.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He couldn’t pay, so his master ordered that he be sold—along with his wife, his children, and everything he owned—to pay the debt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But the man fell down before his master and begged him, ‘Please, be patient with me, and I will pay it all.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then his master was filled with pity for him, and he released him and forgave his debt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But when the man left the king, he went to a fellow servant who owed him a few thousand dollars. He grabbed him by the throat and demanded instant payment.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “His fellow servant fell down before him and begged for a little more time. ‘Be patient with me, and I will pay it,’ he pleaded.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But his creditor wouldn’t wait. He had the man arrested and put in prison until the debt could be paid in full.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “When some of the other servants saw this, they were very upset. They went to the king and told him everything that had happened.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the king called in the man he had forgiven and said, ‘You evil servant! I forgave you that tremendous debt because you pleaded with me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Shouldn’t you have mercy on your fellow servant, just as I had mercy on you?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the angry king sent the man to prison to be tortured until he had paid his entire debt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “That’s what my heavenly Father will do to you if you refuse to forgive your brothers and sisters from your heart.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jesus had finished saying these things, he left Galilee and went down to the region of Judea east of the Jordan River.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Large crowds followed him there, and he healed their sick.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Some Pharisees came and tried to trap him with this question: “Should a man be allowed to divorce his wife for just any reason?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Haven’t you read the Scriptures?” Jesus replied. “They record that from the beginning ‘God made them male and female.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said, “‘This explains why a man leaves his father and mother and is joined to his wife, and the two are united into one.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Since they are no longer two but one, let no one split apart what God has joined together.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Then why did Moses say in the law that a man could give his wife a written notice of divorce and send her away?” they asked.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus replied, “Moses permitted divorce only as a concession to your hard hearts, but it was not what God had originally intended.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I tell you this, whoever divorces his wife and marries someone else commits adultery—unless his wife has been unfaithful.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus’ disciples then said to him, “If this is the case, it is better not to marry!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Not everyone can accept this statement,” Jesus said. “Only those whom God helps.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Some are born as eunuchs, some have been made eunuchs by others, and some choose not to marry for the sake of the Kingdom of Heaven. Let anyone accept this who can.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: One day some parents brought their children to Jesus so he could lay his hands on them and pray for them. But the disciples scolded the parents for bothering him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus said, “Let the children come to me. Don’t stop them! For the Kingdom of Heaven belongs to those who are like these children.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he placed his hands on their heads and blessed them before he left.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Someone came to Jesus with this question: “Teacher, what good deed must I do to have eternal life?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Why ask me about what is good?” Jesus replied. “There is only One who is good. But to answer your question—if you want to receive eternal life, keep the commandments.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Which ones?” the man asked.
And Jesus replied: “‘You must not murder. You must not commit adultery. You must not steal. You must not testify falsely.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Honor your father and mother. Love your neighbor as yourself.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I’ve obeyed all these commandments,” the young man replied. “What else must I do?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus told him, “If you want to be perfect, go and sell all your possessions and give the money to the poor, and you will have treasure in heaven. Then come, follow me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when the young man heard this, he went away sad, for he had many possessions.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus said to his disciples, “I tell you the truth, it is very hard for a rich person to enter the Kingdom of Heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I’ll say it again—it is easier for a camel to go through the eye of a needle than for a rich person to enter the Kingdom of God!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The disciples were astounded. “Then who in the world can be saved?” they asked.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus looked at them intently and said, “Humanly speaking, it is impossible. But with God everything is possible.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Peter said to him, “We’ve given up everything to follow you. What will we get?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus replied, “I assure you that when the world is made new and the Son of Man sits upon his glorious throne, you who have been my followers will also sit on twelve thrones, judging the twelve tribes of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And everyone who has given up houses or brothers or sisters or father or mother or children or property, for my sake, will receive a hundred times as much in return and will inherit eternal life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But many who are the greatest now will be least important then, and those who seem least important now will be the greatest then.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “For the Kingdom of Heaven is like the landowner who went out early one morning to hire workers for his vineyard.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He agreed to pay the normal daily wage and sent them out to work.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “At nine o’clock in the morning he was passing through the marketplace and saw some people standing around doing nothing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he hired them, telling them he would pay them whatever was right at the end of the day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they went to work in the vineyard. At noon and again at three o’clock he did the same thing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “At five o’clock that afternoon he was in town again and saw some more people standing around. He asked them, ‘Why haven’t you been working today?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“They replied, ‘Because no one hired us.’
“The landowner told them, ‘Then go out and join the others in my vineyard.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “That evening he told the foreman to call the workers in and pay them, beginning with the last workers first.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When those hired at five o’clock were paid, each received a full day’s wage.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When those hired first came to get their pay, they assumed they would receive more. But they, too, were paid a day’s wage.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they received their pay, they protested to the owner,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘Those people worked only one hour, and yet you’ve paid them just as much as you paid us who worked all day in the scorching heat.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “He answered one of them, ‘Friend, I haven’t been unfair! Didn’t you agree to work all day for the usual wage?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Take your money and go. I wanted to pay this last worker the same as you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Is it against the law for me to do what I want with my money? Should you be jealous because I am kind to others?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “So those who are last now will be first then, and those who are first will be last.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As Jesus was going up to Jerusalem, he took the twelve disciples aside privately and told them what was going to happen to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Listen,” he said, “we’re going up to Jerusalem, where the Son of Man will be betrayed to the leading priests and the teachers of religious law. They will sentence him to die.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they will hand him over to the Romans to be mocked, flogged with a whip, and crucified. But on the third day he will be raised from the dead.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the mother of James and John, the sons of Zebedee, came to Jesus with her sons. She knelt respectfully to ask a favor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“What is your request?” he asked.
She replied, “In your Kingdom, please let my two sons sit in places of honor next to you, one on your right and the other on your left.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But Jesus answered by saying to them, “You don’t know what you are asking! Are you able to drink from the bitter cup of suffering I am about to drink?”
“Oh yes,” they replied, “we are able!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus told them, “You will indeed drink from my bitter cup. But I have no right to say who will sit on my right or my left. My Father has prepared those places for the ones he has chosen.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the ten other disciples heard what James and John had asked, they were indignant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus called them together and said, “You know that the rulers in this world lord it over their people, and officials flaunt their authority over those under them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But among you it will be different. Whoever wants to be a leader among you must be your servant,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and whoever wants to be first among you must become your slave.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For even the Son of Man came not to be served but to serve others and to give his life as a ransom for many.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As Jesus and the disciples left the town of Jericho, a large crowd followed behind.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Two blind men were sitting beside the road. When they heard that Jesus was coming that way, they began shouting, “Lord, Son of David, have mercy on us!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Be quiet!” the crowd yelled at them.
But they only shouted louder, “Lord, Son of David, have mercy on us!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jesus heard them, he stopped and called, “What do you want me to do for you?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Lord,” they said, “we want to see!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus felt sorry for them and touched their eyes. Instantly they could see! Then they followed him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As Jesus and the disciples approached Jerusalem, they came to the town of Bethphage on the Mount of Olives. Jesus sent two of them on ahead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Go into the village over there,” he said. “As soon as you enter it, you will see a donkey tied there, with its colt beside it. Untie them and bring them to me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If anyone asks what you are doing, just say, ‘The Lord needs them,’ and he will immediately let you take them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This took place to fulfill the prophecy that said,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Tell the people of Jerusalem,
    ‘Look, your King is coming to you.
He is humble, riding on a donkey—
    riding on a donkey’s colt.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The two disciples did as Jesus commanded.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They brought the donkey and the colt to him and threw their garments over the colt, and he sat on it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Most of the crowd spread their garments on the road ahead of him, and others cut branches from the trees and spread them on the road.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Jesus was in the center of the procession, and the people all around him were shouting, 
“Praise God for the Son of David!
    Blessings on the one who comes in the name of the Lord!
    Praise God in highest heaven!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The entire city of Jerusalem was in an uproar as he entered. “Who is this?” they asked.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the crowds replied, “It’s Jesus, the prophet from Nazareth in Galilee.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus entered the Temple and began to drive out all the people buying and selling animals for sacrifice. He knocked over the tables of the money changers and the chairs of those selling doves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “The Scriptures declare, ‘My Temple will be called a house of prayer,’ but you have turned it into a den of thieves!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The blind and the lame came to him in the Temple, and he healed them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The leading priests and the teachers of religious law saw these wonderful miracles and heard even the children in the Temple shouting, “Praise God for the Son of David.”
But the leaders were indignant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They asked Jesus, “Do you hear what these children are saying?”
“Yes,” Jesus replied. “Haven’t you ever read the Scriptures? For they say, ‘You have taught children and infants to give you praise.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he returned to Bethany, where he stayed overnight.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the morning, as Jesus was returning to Jerusalem, he was hungry,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he noticed a fig tree beside the road. He went over to see if there were any figs, but there were only leaves. Then he said to it, “May you never bear fruit again!” And immediately the fig tree withered up.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The disciples were amazed when they saw this and asked, “How did the fig tree wither so quickly?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus told them, “I tell you the truth, if you have faith and don’t doubt, you can do things like this and much more. You can even say to this mountain, ‘May you be lifted up and thrown into the sea,’ and it will happen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You can pray for anything, and if you have faith, you will receive it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jesus returned to the Temple and began teaching, the leading priests and elders came up to him. They demanded, “By what authority are you doing all these things? Who gave you the right?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I’ll tell you by what authority I do these things if you answer one question,” Jesus replied.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Did John’s authority to baptize come from heaven, or was it merely human?”
They talked it over among themselves. “If we say it was from heaven, he will ask us why we didn’t believe John.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if we say it was merely human, we’ll be mobbed because the people believe John was a prophet.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So they finally replied, “We don’t know.”
And Jesus responded, “Then I won’t tell you by what authority I do these things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But what do you think about this? A man with two sons told the older boy, ‘Son, go out and work in the vineyard today.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The son answered, ‘No, I won’t go,’ but later he changed his mind and went anyway.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the father told the other son, ‘You go,’ and he said, ‘Yes, sir, I will.’ But he didn’t go.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Which of the two obeyed his father?”
They replied, “The first.”
Then Jesus explained his meaning: “I tell you the truth, corrupt tax collectors and prostitutes will get into the Kingdom of God before you do.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For John the Baptist came and showed you the right way to live, but you didn’t believe him, while tax collectors and prostitutes did. And even when you saw this happening, you refused to believe him and repent of your sins.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Now listen to another story. A certain landowner planted a vineyard, built a wall around it, dug a pit for pressing out the grape juice, and built a lookout tower. Then he leased the vineyard to tenant farmers and moved to another country.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At the time of the grape harvest, he sent his servants to collect his share of the crop.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the farmers grabbed his servants, beat one, killed one, and stoned another.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the landowner sent a larger group of his servants to collect for him, but the results were the same.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Finally, the owner sent his son, thinking, ‘Surely they will respect my son.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But when the tenant farmers saw his son coming, they said to one another, ‘Here comes the heir to this estate. Come on, let’s kill him and get the estate for ourselves!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they grabbed him, dragged him out of the vineyard, and murdered him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “When the owner of the vineyard returns,” Jesus asked, “what do you think he will do to those farmers?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The religious leaders replied, “He will put the wicked men to a horrible death and lease the vineyard to others who will give him his share of the crop after each harvest.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then Jesus asked them, “Didn’t you ever read this in the Scriptures?
‘The stone that the builders rejected
    has now become the cornerstone.
This is the Lord’s doing,
    and it is wonderful to see.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I tell you, the Kingdom of God will be taken away from you and given to a nation that will produce the proper fruit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Anyone who stumbles over that stone will be broken to pieces, and it will crush anyone it falls on.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the leading priests and Pharisees heard this parable, they realized he was telling the story against them—they were the wicked farmers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They wanted to arrest him, but they were afraid of the crowds, who considered Jesus to be a prophet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus also told them other parables. He said,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The Kingdom of Heaven can be illustrated by the story of a king who prepared a great wedding feast for his son.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the banquet was ready, he sent his servants to notify those who were invited. But they all refused to come!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “So he sent other servants to tell them, ‘The feast has been prepared. The bulls and fattened cattle have been killed, and everything is ready. Come to the banquet!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the guests he had invited ignored them and went their own way, one to his farm, another to his business.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Others seized his messengers and insulted them and killed them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The king was furious, and he sent out his army to destroy the murderers and burn their town.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said to his servants, ‘The wedding feast is ready, and the guests I invited aren’t worthy of the honor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now go out to the street corners and invite everyone you see.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the servants brought in everyone they could find, good and bad alike, and the banquet hall was filled with guests.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But when the king came in to meet the guests, he noticed a man who wasn’t wearing the proper clothes for a wedding.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘Friend,’ he asked, ‘how is it that you are here without wedding clothes?’ But the man had no reply.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the king said to his aides, ‘Bind his hands and feet and throw him into the outer darkness, where there will be weeping and gnashing of teeth.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “For many are called, but few are chosen.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Pharisees met together to plot how to trap Jesus into saying something for which he could be arrested.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They sent some of their disciples, along with the supporters of Herod, to meet with him. “Teacher,” they said, “we know how honest you are. You teach the way of God truthfully. You are impartial and don’t play favorites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now tell us what you think about this: Is it right to pay taxes to Caesar or not?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus knew their evil motives. “You hypocrites!” he said. “Why are you trying to trap me?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Here, show me the coin used for the tax.” When they handed him a Roman coin,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: he asked, “Whose picture and title are stamped on it?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Caesar’s,” they replied.
“Well, then,” he said, “give to Caesar what belongs to Caesar, and give to God what belongs to God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His reply amazed them, and they went away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: That same day Jesus was approached by some Sadducees—religious leaders who say there is no resurrection from the dead. They posed this question:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Teacher, Moses said, ‘If a man dies without children, his brother should marry the widow and have a child who will carry on the brother’s name.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Well, suppose there were seven brothers. The oldest one married and then died without children, so his brother married the widow.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the second brother also died, and the third brother married her. This continued with all seven of them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Last of all, the woman also died.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So tell us, whose wife will she be in the resurrection? For all seven were married to her.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus replied, “Your mistake is that you don’t know the Scriptures, and you don’t know the power of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For when the dead rise, they will neither marry nor be given in marriage. In this respect they will be like the angels in heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But now, as to whether there will be a resurrection of the dead—haven’t you ever read about this in the Scriptures? Long after Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob had died, God said,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘I am the God of Abraham, the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob.’ So he is the God of the living, not the dead.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the crowds heard him, they were astounded at his teaching.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when the Pharisees heard that he had silenced the Sadducees with his reply, they met together to question him again.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: One of them, an expert in religious law, tried to trap him with this question:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Teacher, which is the most important commandment in the law of Moses?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus replied, “‘You must love the Lord your God with all your heart, all your soul, and all your mind.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is the first and greatest commandment.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A second is equally important: ‘Love your neighbor as yourself.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The entire law and all the demands of the prophets are based on these two commandments.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then, surrounded by the Pharisees, Jesus asked them a question:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“What do you think about the Messiah? Whose son is he?”
They replied, “He is the son of David.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus responded, “Then why does David, speaking under the inspiration of the Spirit, call the Messiah ‘my Lord’? For David said,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
‘The Lord said to my Lord,
Sit in the place of honor at my right hand
    until I humble your enemies beneath your feet.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Since David called the Messiah ‘my Lord,’ how can the Messiah be his son?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: No one could answer him. And after that, no one dared to ask him any more questions.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus said to the crowds and to his disciples,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The teachers of religious law and the Pharisees are the official interpreters of the law of Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So practice and obey whatever they tell you, but don’t follow their example. For they don’t practice what they teach.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They crush people with unbearable religious demands and never lift a finger to ease the burden.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Everything they do is for show. On their arms they wear extra wide prayer boxes with Scripture verses inside, and they wear robes with extra long tassels.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they love to sit at the head table at banquets and in the seats of honor in the synagogues.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They love to receive respectful greetings as they walk in the marketplaces, and to be called ‘Rabbi.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Don’t let anyone call you ‘Rabbi,’ for you have only one teacher, and all of you are equal as brothers and sisters.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And don’t address anyone here on earth as ‘Father,’ for only God in heaven is your Father.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And don’t let anyone call you ‘Teacher,’ for you have only one teacher, the Messiah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The greatest among you must be a servant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But those who exalt themselves will be humbled, and those who humble themselves will be exalted.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “What sorrow awaits you teachers of religious law and you Pharisees. Hypocrites! For you shut the door of the Kingdom of Heaven in people’s faces. You won’t go in yourselves, and you don’t let others enter either.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “What sorrow awaits you teachers of religious law and you Pharisees. Hypocrites! For you cross land and sea to make one convert, and then you turn that person into twice the child of hell you yourselves are!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Blind guides! What sorrow awaits you! For you say that it means nothing to swear ‘by God’s Temple,’ but that it is binding to swear ‘by the gold in the Temple.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Blind fools! Which is more important—the gold or the Temple that makes the gold sacred?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you say that to swear ‘by the altar’ is not binding, but to swear ‘by the gifts on the altar’ is binding.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: How blind! For which is more important—the gift on the altar or the altar that makes the gift sacred?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When you swear ‘by the altar,’ you are swearing by it and by everything on it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when you swear ‘by the Temple,’ you are swearing by it and by God, who lives in it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when you swear ‘by heaven,’ you are swearing by the throne of God and by God, who sits on the throne.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “What sorrow awaits you teachers of religious law and you Pharisees. Hypocrites! For you are careful to tithe even the tiniest income from your herb gardens, but you ignore the more important aspects of the law—justice, mercy, and faith. You should tithe, yes, but do not neglect the more important things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Blind guides! You strain your water so you won’t accidentally swallow a gnat, but you swallow a camel!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “What sorrow awaits you teachers of religious law and you Pharisees. Hypocrites! For you are so careful to clean the outside of the cup and the dish, but inside you are filthy—full of greed and self-indulgence!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You blind Pharisee! First wash the inside of the cup and the dish, and then the outside will become clean, too.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “What sorrow awaits you teachers of religious law and you Pharisees. Hypocrites! For you are like whitewashed tombs—beautiful on the outside but filled on the inside with dead people’s bones and all sorts of impurity.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Outwardly you look like righteous people, but inwardly your hearts are filled with hypocrisy and lawlessness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “What sorrow awaits you teachers of religious law and you Pharisees. Hypocrites! For you build tombs for the prophets your ancestors killed, and you decorate the monuments of the godly people your ancestors destroyed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then you say, ‘If we had lived in the days of our ancestors, we would never have joined them in killing the prophets.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But in saying that, you testify against yourselves that you are indeed the descendants of those who murdered the prophets.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Go ahead and finish what your ancestors started.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Snakes! Sons of vipers! How will you escape the judgment of hell?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Therefore, I am sending you prophets and wise men and teachers of religious law. But you will kill some by crucifixion, and you will flog others with whips in your synagogues, chasing them from city to city.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As a result, you will be held responsible for the murder of all godly people of all time—from the murder of righteous Abel to the murder of Zechariah son of Berekiah, whom you killed in the Temple between the sanctuary and the altar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I tell you the truth, this judgment will fall on this very generation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “O Jerusalem, Jerusalem, the city that kills the prophets and stones God’s messengers! How often I have wanted to gather your children together as a hen protects her chicks beneath her wings, but you wouldn’t let me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And now, look, your house is abandoned and desolate.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I tell you this, you will never see me again until you say, ‘Blessings on the one who comes in the name of the Lord!’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As Jesus was leaving the Temple grounds, his disciples pointed out to him the various Temple buildings.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he responded, “Do you see all these buildings? I tell you the truth, they will be completely demolished. Not one stone will be left on top of another!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Later, Jesus sat on the Mount of Olives. His disciples came to him privately and said, “Tell us, when will all this happen? What sign will signal your return and the end of the world?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus told them, “Don’t let anyone mislead you,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for many will come in my name, claiming, ‘I am the Messiah.’ They will deceive many.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you will hear of wars and threats of wars, but don’t panic. Yes, these things must take place, but the end won’t follow immediately.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Nation will go to war against nation, and kingdom against kingdom. There will be famines and earthquakes in many parts of the world.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But all this is only the first of the birth pains, with more to come.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Then you will be arrested, persecuted, and killed. You will be hated all over the world because you are my followers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And many will turn away from me and betray and hate each other.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And many false prophets will appear and will deceive many people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Sin will be rampant everywhere, and the love of many will grow cold.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the one who endures to the end will be saved.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Good News about the Kingdom will be preached throughout the whole world, so that all nations will hear it; and then the end will come.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The day is coming when you will see what Daniel the prophet spoke about—the sacrilegious object that causes desecration standing in the Holy Place.” (Reader, pay attention!)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Then those in Judea must flee to the hills.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A person out on the deck of a roof must not go down into the house to pack.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A person out in the field must not return even to get a coat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: How terrible it will be for pregnant women and for nursing mothers in those days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And pray that your flight will not be in winter or on the Sabbath.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For there will be greater anguish than at any time since the world began. And it will never be so great again.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In fact, unless that time of calamity is shortened, not a single person will survive. But it will be shortened for the sake of God’s chosen ones.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Then if anyone tells you, ‘Look, here is the Messiah,’ or ‘There he is,’ don’t believe it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For false messiahs and false prophets will rise up and perform great signs and wonders so as to deceive, if possible, even God’s chosen ones.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: See, I have warned you about this ahead of time.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “So if someone tells you, ‘Look, the Messiah is out in the desert,’ don’t bother to go and look. Or, ‘Look, he is hiding here,’ don’t believe it!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For as the lightning flashes in the east and shines to the west, so it will be when the Son of Man comes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Just as the gathering of vultures shows there is a carcass nearby, so these signs indicate that the end is near.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Immediately after the anguish of those days,
the sun will be darkened,
    the moon will give no light,
the stars will fall from the sky,
    and the powers in the heavens will be shaken.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And then at last, the sign that the Son of Man is coming will appear in the heavens, and there will be deep mourning among all the peoples of the earth. And they will see the Son of Man coming on the clouds of heaven with power and great glory.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he will send out his angels with the mighty blast of a trumpet, and they will gather his chosen ones from all over the world—from the farthest ends of the earth and heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Now learn a lesson from the fig tree. When its branches bud and its leaves begin to sprout, you know that summer is near.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the same way, when you see all these things, you can know his return is very near, right at the door.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I tell you the truth, this generation will not pass from the scene until all these things take place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Heaven and earth will disappear, but my words will never disappear.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “However, no one knows the day or hour when these things will happen, not even the angels in heaven or the Son himself. Only the Father knows.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “When the Son of Man returns, it will be like it was in Noah’s day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In those days before the flood, the people were enjoying banquets and parties and weddings right up to the time Noah entered his boat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: People didn’t realize what was going to happen until the flood came and swept them all away. That is the way it will be when the Son of Man comes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Two men will be working together in the field; one will be taken, the other left.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Two women will be grinding flour at the mill; one will be taken, the other left.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “So you, too, must keep watch! For you don’t know what day your Lord is coming.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Understand this: If a homeowner knew exactly when a burglar was coming, he would keep watch and not permit his house to be broken into.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You also must be ready all the time, for the Son of Man will come when least expected.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “A faithful, sensible servant is one to whom the master can give the responsibility of managing his other household servants and feeding them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If the master returns and finds that the servant has done a good job, there will be a reward.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I tell you the truth, the master will put that servant in charge of all he owns.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But what if the servant is evil and thinks, ‘My master won’t be back for a while,’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he begins beating the other servants, partying, and getting drunk?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The master will return unannounced and unexpected,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he will cut the servant to pieces and assign him a place with the hypocrites. In that place there will be weeping and gnashing of teeth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Then the Kingdom of Heaven will be like ten bridesmaids who took their lamps and went to meet the bridegroom.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Five of them were foolish, and five were wise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The five who were foolish didn’t take enough olive oil for their lamps,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but the other five were wise enough to take along extra oil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the bridegroom was delayed, they all became drowsy and fell asleep.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “At midnight they were roused by the shout, ‘Look, the bridegroom is coming! Come out and meet him!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “All the bridesmaids got up and prepared their lamps.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the five foolish ones asked the others, ‘Please give us some of your oil because our lamps are going out.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But the others replied, ‘We don’t have enough for all of us. Go to a shop and buy some for yourselves.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But while they were gone to buy oil, the bridegroom came. Then those who were ready went in with him to the marriage feast, and the door was locked.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Later, when the other five bridesmaids returned, they stood outside, calling, ‘Lord! Lord! Open the door for us!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But he called back, ‘Believe me, I don’t know you!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “So you, too, must keep watch! For you do not know the day or hour of my return.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Again, the Kingdom of Heaven can be illustrated by the story of a man going on a long trip. He called together his servants and entrusted his money to them while he was gone.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He gave five bags of silver to one, two bags of silver to another, and one bag of silver to the last—dividing it in proportion to their abilities. He then left on his trip.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The servant who received the five bags of silver began to invest the money and earned five more.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The servant with two bags of silver also went to work and earned two more.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the servant who received the one bag of silver dug a hole in the ground and hid the master’s money.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “After a long time their master returned from his trip and called them to give an account of how they had used his money.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The servant to whom he had entrusted the five bags of silver came forward with five more and said, ‘Master, you gave me five bags of silver to invest, and I have earned five more.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The master was full of praise. ‘Well done, my good and faithful servant. You have been faithful in handling this small amount, so now I will give you many more responsibilities. Let’s celebrate together!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The servant who had received the two bags of silver came forward and said, ‘Master, you gave me two bags of silver to invest, and I have earned two more.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The master said, ‘Well done, my good and faithful servant. You have been faithful in handling this small amount, so now I will give you many more responsibilities. Let’s celebrate together!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Then the servant with the one bag of silver came and said, ‘Master, I knew you were a harsh man, harvesting crops you didn’t plant and gathering crops you didn’t cultivate.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I was afraid I would lose your money, so I hid it in the earth. Look, here is your money back.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But the master replied, ‘You wicked and lazy servant! If you knew I harvested crops I didn’t plant and gathered crops I didn’t cultivate,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: why didn’t you deposit my money in the bank? At least I could have gotten some interest on it.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Then he ordered, ‘Take the money from this servant, and give it to the one with the ten bags of silver.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To those who use well what they are given, even more will be given, and they will have an abundance. But from those who do nothing, even what little they have will be taken away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now throw this useless servant into outer darkness, where there will be weeping and gnashing of teeth.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But when the Son of Man comes in his glory, and all the angels with him, then he will sit upon his glorious throne.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the nations will be gathered in his presence, and he will separate the people as a shepherd separates the sheep from the goats.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He will place the sheep at his right hand and the goats at his left.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Then the King will say to those on his right, ‘Come, you who are blessed by my Father, inherit the Kingdom prepared for you from the creation of the world.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I was hungry, and you fed me. I was thirsty, and you gave me a drink. I was a stranger, and you invited me into your home.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I was naked, and you gave me clothing. I was sick, and you cared for me. I was in prison, and you visited me.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Then these righteous ones will reply, ‘Lord, when did we ever see you hungry and feed you? Or thirsty and give you something to drink?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Or a stranger and show you hospitality? Or naked and give you clothing?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When did we ever see you sick or in prison and visit you?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “And the King will say, ‘I tell you the truth, when you did it to one of the least of these my brothers and sisters, you were doing it to me!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Then the King will turn to those on the left and say, ‘Away with you, you cursed ones, into the eternal fire prepared for the devil and his demons.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I was hungry, and you didn’t feed me. I was thirsty, and you didn’t give me a drink.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I was a stranger, and you didn’t invite me into your home. I was naked, and you didn’t give me clothing. I was sick and in prison, and you didn’t visit me.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Then they will reply, ‘Lord, when did we ever see you hungry or thirsty or a stranger or naked or sick or in prison, and not help you?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “And he will answer, ‘I tell you the truth, when you refused to help the least of these my brothers and sisters, you were refusing to help me.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “And they will go away into eternal punishment, but the righteous will go into eternal life.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jesus had finished saying all these things, he said to his disciples,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “As you know, Passover begins in two days, and the Son of Man will be handed over to be crucified.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At that same time the leading priests and elders were meeting at the residence of Caiaphas, the high priest,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: plotting how to capture Jesus secretly and kill him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But not during the Passover celebration,” they agreed, “or the people may riot.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Meanwhile, Jesus was in Bethany at the home of Simon, a man who had previously had leprosy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While he was eating, a woman came in with a beautiful alabaster jar of expensive perfume and poured it over his head.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The disciples were indignant when they saw this. “What a waste!” they said.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “It could have been sold for a high price and the money given to the poor.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus, aware of this, replied, “Why criticize this woman for doing such a good thing to me?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You will always have the poor among you, but you will not always have me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She has poured this perfume on me to prepare my body for burial.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I tell you the truth, wherever the Good News is preached throughout the world, this woman’s deed will be remembered and discussed.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Judas Iscariot, one of the twelve disciples, went to the leading priests
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and asked, “How much will you pay me to betray Jesus to you?” And they gave him thirty pieces of silver.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From that time on, Judas began looking for an opportunity to betray Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the first day of the Festival of Unleavened Bread, the disciples came to Jesus and asked, “Where do you want us to prepare the Passover meal for you?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “As you go into the city,” he told them, “you will see a certain man. Tell him, ‘The Teacher says: My time has come, and I will eat the Passover meal with my disciples at your house.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the disciples did as Jesus told them and prepared the Passover meal there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When it was evening, Jesus sat down at the table with the Twelve.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While they were eating, he said, “I tell you the truth, one of you will betray me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Greatly distressed, each one asked in turn, “Am I the one, Lord?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He replied, “One of you who has just eaten from this bowl with me will betray me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the Son of Man must die, as the Scriptures declared long ago. But how terrible it will be for the one who betrays him. It would be far better for that man if he had never been born!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Judas, the one who would betray him, also asked, “Rabbi, am I the one?”
And Jesus told him, “You have said it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As they were eating, Jesus took some bread and blessed it. Then he broke it in pieces and gave it to the disciples, saying, “Take this and eat it, for this is my body.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he took a cup of wine and gave thanks to God for it. He gave it to them and said, “Each of you drink from it,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for this is my blood, which confirms the covenant between God and his people. It is poured out as a sacrifice to forgive the sins of many.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Mark my words—I will not drink wine again until the day I drink it new with you in my Father’s Kingdom.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they sang a hymn and went out to the Mount of Olives.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
On the way, Jesus told them, “Tonight all of you will desert me. For the Scriptures say,
‘God will strike the Shepherd,
    and the sheep of the flock will be scattered.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But after I have been raised from the dead, I will go ahead of you to Galilee and meet you there.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Peter declared, “Even if everyone else deserts you, I will never desert you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus replied, “I tell you the truth, Peter—this very night, before the rooster crows, you will deny three times that you even know me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “No!” Peter insisted. “Even if I have to die with you, I will never deny you!” And all the other disciples vowed the same.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus went with them to the olive grove called Gethsemane, and he said, “Sit here while I go over there to pray.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He took Peter and Zebedee’s two sons, James and John, and he became anguished and distressed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He told them, “My soul is crushed with grief to the point of death. Stay here and keep watch with me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He went on a little farther and bowed with his face to the ground, praying, “My Father! If it is possible, let this cup of suffering be taken away from me. Yet I want your will to be done, not mine.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he returned to the disciples and found them asleep. He said to Peter, “Couldn’t you watch with me even one hour?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Keep watch and pray, so that you will not give in to temptation. For the spirit is willing, but the body is weak!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus left them a second time and prayed, “My Father! If this cup cannot be taken away unless I drink it, your will be done.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he returned to them again, he found them sleeping, for they couldn’t keep their eyes open.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he went to pray a third time, saying the same things again.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he came to the disciples and said, “Go ahead and sleep. Have your rest. But look—the time has come. The Son of Man is betrayed into the hands of sinners.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Up, let’s be going. Look, my betrayer is here!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And even as Jesus said this, Judas, one of the twelve disciples, arrived with a crowd of men armed with swords and clubs. They had been sent by the leading priests and elders of the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The traitor, Judas, had given them a prearranged signal: “You will know which one to arrest when I greet him with a kiss.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Judas came straight to Jesus. “Greetings, Rabbi!” he exclaimed and gave him the kiss.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Jesus said, “My friend, go ahead and do what you have come for.”
Then the others grabbed Jesus and arrested him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But one of the men with Jesus pulled out his sword and struck the high priest’s slave, slashing off his ear.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Put away your sword,” Jesus told him. “Those who use the sword will die by the sword.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Don’t you realize that I could ask my Father for thousands of angels to protect us, and he would send them instantly?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if I did, how would the Scriptures be fulfilled that describe what must happen now?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus said to the crowd, “Am I some dangerous revolutionary, that you come with swords and clubs to arrest me? Why didn’t you arrest me in the Temple? I was there teaching every day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But this is all happening to fulfill the words of the prophets as recorded in the Scriptures.” At that point, all the disciples deserted him and fled.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the people who had arrested Jesus led him to the home of Caiaphas, the high priest, where the teachers of religious law and the elders had gathered.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Meanwhile, Peter followed him at a distance and came to the high priest’s courtyard. He went in and sat with the guards and waited to see how it would all end.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Inside, the leading priests and the entire high council were trying to find witnesses who would lie about Jesus, so they could put him to death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But even though they found many who agreed to give false witness, they could not use anyone’s testimony. Finally, two men came forward
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who declared, “This man said, ‘I am able to destroy the Temple of God and rebuild it in three days.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the high priest stood up and said to Jesus, “Well, aren’t you going to answer these charges? What do you have to say for yourself?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus remained silent. Then the high priest said to him, “I demand in the name of the living God—tell us if you are the Messiah, the Son of God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus replied, “You have said it. And in the future you will see the Son of Man seated in the place of power at God’s right hand and coming on the clouds of heaven.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the high priest tore his clothing to show his horror and said, “Blasphemy! Why do we need other witnesses? You have all heard his blasphemy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
What is your verdict?”
“Guilty!” they shouted. “He deserves to die!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they began to spit in Jesus’ face and beat him with their fists. And some slapped him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: jeering, “Prophesy to us, you Messiah! Who hit you that time?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Meanwhile, Peter was sitting outside in the courtyard. A servant girl came over and said to him, “You were one of those with Jesus the Galilean.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Peter denied it in front of everyone. “I don’t know what you’re talking about,” he said.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Later, out by the gate, another servant girl noticed him and said to those standing around, “This man was with Jesus of Nazareth.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Again Peter denied it, this time with an oath. “I don’t even know the man,” he said.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A little later some of the other bystanders came over to Peter and said, “You must be one of them; we can tell by your Galilean accent.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Peter swore, “A curse on me if I’m lying—I don’t know the man!” And immediately the rooster crowed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Suddenly, Jesus’ words flashed through Peter’s mind: “Before the rooster crows, you will deny three times that you even know me.” And he went away, weeping bitterly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Very early in the morning the leading priests and the elders of the people met again to lay plans for putting Jesus to death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they bound him, led him away, and took him to Pilate, the Roman governor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Judas, who had betrayed him, realized that Jesus had been condemned to die, he was filled with remorse. So he took the thirty pieces of silver back to the leading priests and the elders.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“I have sinned,” he declared, “for I have betrayed an innocent man.”
“What do we care?” they retorted. “That’s your problem.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Judas threw the silver coins down in the Temple and went out and hanged himself.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The leading priests picked up the coins. “It wouldn’t be right to put this money in the Temple treasury,” they said, “since it was payment for murder.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After some discussion they finally decided to buy the potter’s field, and they made it into a cemetery for foreigners.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: That is why the field is still called the Field of Blood.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
This fulfilled the prophecy of Jeremiah that says,
“They took the thirty pieces of silver—
    the price at which he was valued by the people of Israel,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
and purchased the potter’s field,
    as the Lord directed.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Now Jesus was standing before Pilate, the Roman governor. “Are you the king of the Jews?” the governor asked him.
Jesus replied, “You have said it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when the leading priests and the elders made their accusations against him, Jesus remained silent.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Don’t you hear all these charges they are bringing against you?” Pilate demanded.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus made no response to any of the charges, much to the governor’s surprise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now it was the governor’s custom each year during the Passover celebration to release one prisoner to the crowd—anyone they wanted.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This year there was a notorious prisoner, a man named Barabbas.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As the crowds gathered before Pilate’s house that morning, he asked them, “Which one do you want me to release to you—Barabbas, or Jesus who is called the Messiah?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (He knew very well that the religious leaders had arrested Jesus out of envy.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Just then, as Pilate was sitting on the judgment seat, his wife sent him this message: “Leave that innocent man alone. I suffered through a terrible nightmare about him last night.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Meanwhile, the leading priests and the elders persuaded the crowd to ask for Barabbas to be released and for Jesus to be put to death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So the governor asked again, “Which of these two do you want me to release to you?”
The crowd shouted back, “Barabbas!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Pilate responded, “Then what should I do with Jesus who is called the Messiah?”
They shouted back, “Crucify him!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Why?” Pilate demanded. “What crime has he committed?”
But the mob roared even louder, “Crucify him!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Pilate saw that he wasn’t getting anywhere and that a riot was developing. So he sent for a bowl of water and washed his hands before the crowd, saying, “I am innocent of this man’s blood. The responsibility is yours!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And all the people yelled back, “We will take responsibility for his death—we and our children!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Pilate released Barabbas to them. He ordered Jesus flogged with a lead-tipped whip, then turned him over to the Roman soldiers to be crucified.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Some of the governor’s soldiers took Jesus into their headquarters and called out the entire regiment.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They stripped him and put a scarlet robe on him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They wove thorn branches into a crown and put it on his head, and they placed a reed stick in his right hand as a scepter. Then they knelt before him in mockery and taunted, “Hail! King of the Jews!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they spit on him and grabbed the stick and struck him on the head with it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they were finally tired of mocking him, they took off the robe and put his own clothes on him again. Then they led him away to be crucified.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Along the way, they came across a man named Simon, who was from Cyrene, and the soldiers forced him to carry Jesus’ cross.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they went out to a place called Golgotha (which means “Place of the Skull”).
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The soldiers gave Jesus wine mixed with bitter gall, but when he had tasted it, he refused to drink it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After they had nailed him to the cross, the soldiers gambled for his clothes by throwing dice.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they sat around and kept guard as he hung there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A sign was fastened above Jesus’ head, announcing the charge against him. It read: “This is Jesus, the King of the Jews.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Two revolutionaries were crucified with him, one on his right and one on his left.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The people passing by shouted abuse, shaking their heads in mockery.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Look at you now!” they yelled at him. “You said you were going to destroy the Temple and rebuild it in three days. Well then, if you are the Son of God, save yourself and come down from the cross!”
verses.speaker: Narrator
