verses.text: The leading priests, the teachers of religious law, and the elders also mocked Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “He saved others,” they scoffed, “but he can’t save himself! So he is the King of Israel, is he? Let him come down from the cross right now, and we will believe in him!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He trusted God, so let God rescue him now if he wants him! For he said, ‘I am the Son of God.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Even the revolutionaries who were crucified with him ridiculed him in the same way.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At noon, darkness fell across the whole land until three o’clock.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At about three o’clock, Jesus called out with a loud voice, “Eli, Eli, lema sabachthani?” which means “My God, my God, why have you abandoned me?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Some of the bystanders misunderstood and thought he was calling for the prophet Elijah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: One of them ran and filled a sponge with sour wine, holding it up to him on a reed stick so he could drink.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the rest said, “Wait! Let’s see whether Elijah comes to save him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus shouted out again, and he released his spirit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At that moment the curtain in the sanctuary of the Temple was torn in two, from top to bottom. The earth shook, rocks split apart,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and tombs opened. The bodies of many godly men and women who had died were raised from the dead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They left the cemetery after Jesus’ resurrection, went into the holy city of Jerusalem, and appeared to many people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Roman officer and the other soldiers at the crucifixion were terrified by the earthquake and all that had happened. They said, “This man truly was the Son of God!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And many women who had come from Galilee with Jesus to care for him were watching from a distance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Among them were Mary Magdalene, Mary (the mother of James and Joseph), and the mother of James and John, the sons of Zebedee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As evening approached, Joseph, a rich man from Arimathea who had become a follower of Jesus,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: went to Pilate and asked for Jesus’ body. And Pilate issued an order to release it to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joseph took the body and wrapped it in a long sheet of clean linen cloth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He placed it in his own new tomb, which had been carved out of the rock. Then he rolled a great stone across the entrance and left.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Both Mary Magdalene and the other Mary were sitting across from the tomb and watching.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The next day, on the Sabbath, the leading priests and Pharisees went to see Pilate.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They told him, “Sir, we remember what that deceiver once said while he was still alive: ‘After three days I will rise from the dead.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So we request that you seal the tomb until the third day. This will prevent his disciples from coming and stealing his body and then telling everyone he was raised from the dead! If that happens, we’ll be worse off than we were at first.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Pilate replied, “Take guards and secure it the best you can.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they sealed the tomb and posted guards to protect it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Early on Sunday morning, as the new day was dawning, Mary Magdalene and the other Mary went out to visit the tomb.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Suddenly there was a great earthquake! For an angel of the Lord came down from heaven, rolled aside the stone, and sat on it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His face shone like lightning, and his clothing was as white as snow.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The guards shook with fear when they saw him, and they fell into a dead faint.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the angel spoke to the women. “Don’t be afraid!” he said. “I know you are looking for Jesus, who was crucified.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He isn’t here! He is risen from the dead, just as he said would happen. Come, see where his body was lying.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And now, go quickly and tell his disciples that he has risen from the dead, and he is going ahead of you to Galilee. You will see him there. Remember what I have told you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The women ran quickly from the tomb. They were very frightened but also filled with great joy, and they rushed to give the disciples the angel’s message.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as they went, Jesus met them and greeted them. And they ran to him, grasped his feet, and worshiped him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus said to them, “Don’t be afraid! Go tell my brothers to leave for Galilee, and they will see me there.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As the women were on their way, some of the guards went into the city and told the leading priests what had happened.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A meeting with the elders was called, and they decided to give the soldiers a large bribe.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They told the soldiers, “You must say, ‘Jesus’ disciples came during the night while we were sleeping, and they stole his body.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If the governor hears about it, we’ll stand up for you so you won’t get in trouble.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the guards accepted the bribe and said what they were told to say. Their story spread widely among the Jews, and they still tell it today.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the eleven disciples left for Galilee, going to the mountain where Jesus had told them to go.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they saw him, they worshiped him—but some of them doubted!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus came and told his disciples, “I have been given all authority in heaven and on earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, go and make disciples of all the nations, baptizing them in the name of the Father and the Son and the Holy Spirit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Teach these new disciples to obey all the commands I have given you. And be sure of this: I am with you always, even to the end of the age.”
verses.speaker: Narrator
